items.title: Component Architecture
items.description: Three-layer hierarchy: 1-app-shell (page frame), 2-primitives (layout regions/containers), 3-components (UI elements). Folder structure documents the architecture - numbered folders show usage order.

items.title: App Shell Types
items.description: Two shell layouts: app-shell-stacked (vertical header/main/footer for sites, blogs, landing pages) and app-shell-sidebar (horizontal sidebar + content for docs, admin, dashboard). Both use CSS Grid with --shell-gap token.

items.title: Nav Patterns
items.description: Four nav components named by visual pattern: nav-bar (horizontal + dropdowns), nav-accordion (vertical + expand), nav-rail (vertical + icons), nav-tree (explorer-style, to be built). All use slots for native <a> tags (SEO-friendly).

items.title: Web Component Slots
items.description: Components use <slot> for content projection (like Angular ng-content). Component controls behavior/structure, user controls content. Enables native <a> tags inside nav items for SEO. Pattern: component wraps behavior, user slots in their HTML.
